rComments: One of the greatest professors I have ever had. He has great passion for teaching economics and it shows through his preparation & presentation of his lectures. His level of expertise made the material much easier to comprehend and more enjoyable. I would recommend taking any and all classes with him. He is tough but fair and thats all one can ask.

This guy rocks. I completely knew nothing about econometrics and after taking his course I fell in love with it. This guy has so much passion, talent, and organize class structure that can help you succeed. Assignment are tough, but if you do it you will learn, there are tons of resource available (smart TAs, great slides).  It is really do-able!

First we need to note ECON 113 could be the toughest course out of all BME classes for a lot of people. George is an excellent guy that has so much passion in this subject to help us understand the material. He has very organized slides, structures and resources. As this is not an easy class, you will need to work hard, but George will motivate you

Honestly my favorite Econ department professor. I really enjoyed taking this class. He is very clear and super excited about what he teaches, which makes his lectures more awesome. Homework assignments can be tough, but tests are very fair. I would definitely take any class just because he is teaching it
One of my favorite econ professors for sure. Best 113 professor.

Bulman puts a lot of time to make sure everything in the class would be put together correctly the first time around teaching this class. He provided a number of academic paper examples and makes a variety of new econometric methods highly accessible.

Makes a complicated subject simple and straightforward. Engaging lecturer, who makes his classes interactive. Helpful during office hours. He posts lecture slides in advance, is explicit about grades, and posts answers to homework. I got one of the highest grades in the class. I only wish I had the time to enjoy it more (was taking 4 other classes)

Best professor I've ever had at UCSC. Brilliant, and genuinely interested in teaching you the material. His slides are ALL you need to study from. Attendance is not mandatory but I went every day, paid attention, and printed the slides beforehand to take notes on - got an A+. Book not necessary, exams straight forward. Sections help - take him!
Bulman is clear and engaging. The assignments and exams were challenging but fair. Overall, this was one of the better classes I have taken.

I found the homework to not be straightforward and exams to be pretty hard. For the homework, the TAs can help a lot. His exams were super tedious for a 70 min class, many students didn't finish. I felt he wasn't a good teacher at the start of the quarter but improved as it went on. Hopefully that continues.

Honestly just a hard class made harder by  the professor. George is a nice guy but his class is very theoretical and he doesn't offer much in the way of accessible information. His notes were fill in the blank, there are no practice exams, he gives brutal midterms, and no exceptions made, ever. Advice: go to office hrs, the TAs rock!
He is a really good and engaging teacher. His exams are hard and cover most of the material discussed in class. His notes are really useful.

Going to lecture and section are not mandatory but extremely helpful!  I definitely recommend attending!  He is super thorough and goes over the lecture slides and examples until you get it.  His exams are straight forward and does not try to trick you.  Super fair with grading.  Honestly one of the best upper division Econ professors I've had.

The material of this class is tough, but Bulman has his ways of making you learn. He is great at explaining concepts and is definitely someone to visit in office hours. He shows a general interest in the well-being of his students and loves engaging people in class. Ask questions in class!

George is fantastic at keeping the class interested in the material, as Econometrics by nature, is a very dry subject. There are 2 midterms, 1 final, and 5 homework sets. Those who go to class are greatly rewarded through better grades, as he teaches through examples which often appear on tests. Strongly recommended.

Uses lots of examples and talks you through them, class and section wasn't mandatory but without them it is very hard to do the homework's with just the book. Plus they did questions form the teacher in section and went over STATA a program you use to analyze data. He's funny and down to earth and there is plenty of help available
